turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You told them that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's true, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What the fuck's that got to do with it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They know I'm delivering for you. I mention the half-million -- they don't give a fuck about that -- They want you with guns. So I say, well, if you want proof he's getting paid for selling them, let me bring the money in.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What did they say?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...I make two deliveries. The first one with ten thousand, like a dry run. They watch it. See how it works. Then we do a second delivery, when I bring in the half mill.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Naw, naw, that's too much exposure. I ain't goin anywhere near that money.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You don't have to. I told 'em you're real careful. You never pick up money yourself. You always send someone, and I never know who it is.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That's a good idea.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If you just listen, you'll see it's a damn good idea. The first time I do it they're lurking about. They see me hand the ten thousand to someone.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know. One of your friends.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: A woman.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If you want.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Yeah, I think a woman.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The next trip, when I come with all the money, it'll look like I hand it to the same one I did before...

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: But you don't?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, I give it to someone else first.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: And they follow the wrong one thinkin' she's bringing it to me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's the idea.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: So we need two people, two women.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Can you cover that?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I got the woman covered. Where you thinkin' about doin' this?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I was thinkin' the Del Amo Mall. In the food court.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I suppose you see a piece of this for yourself?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, it's my plan. We're in this together.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Yeah, but it's my money, and I don't need me a partner.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I ain't your partner, I'm your manager. I'm managing to get your money out of Mexico, into America, in your hands, and I'm managing to do all this under the nose of the cops. That makes me your manager, and managers get fifteen percent.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Managers get ten percent.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's an agent. Manager's get fifteen percent.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I'll give ya ten.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Plus the same deal as before.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I can do that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The money's in a Broadway shopping bag. I get some food, and sit down here in the food court. Then your girl comes -- you got somebody yet?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What'd you care?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Look, it's my ass facin' the penitentiary. You send some hard- headed roc whore, and she fucks things up.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I ain't gonna send no roc whore. The woman's cool, I promise.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Drink?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I need to talk to you alone.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't want no more fuckin' surprises. We do this the way I laid it out, or we don't do it at all.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What the hell you talkin' bout?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sheronda passin' the money onto someone else, that's what the hell I'm talkin' 'bout.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: How do you know she did that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I was there, I saw her do it.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, you weren't supposed to be there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know, but I hung around, 'cause I figured you'd try an' pull some shit like this.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Now, hold on there. I ain't pullin' no shit. It's my money, I can do whatever the fuck I wanna do with it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not when it's my ass on the line you don't. We do this my way or fuck it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Nicolet and Dargus stop me at the airport and mark the bills.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Man, I don't like that part.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It washes off. I tell them we're doing it the same way as before. They'll follow Sheronda. I hate the idea of leaving her for a fall.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She won't have no problems 'cause she don't know nothin'.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Are you sure she don't know about the money?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She don't know shit about the money.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What does she think she's gettin?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I told her this is a game us rich folks play, exchanging gifts. Like a scavenger hunt. She didn't know what that was neither.  No answer?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: No, you gonna give her a Robinson's/May bag this time?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Right, the one Simone gives me. Simone and I'll make the switch at Robinson's/May. She knows what I look like?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She saw you with Sheronda. So Simone goes to the dress department with her Robinson's/May bag.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Designer clothes.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She waits for you to go in the place where you try things on.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The fitting room. There's a sign over the door.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: So you come out with her Robinson's/May bag, go meet Sheronda. Simone peeks out, waits for my man Louis here to give her a signal nobody's watchin'. She leaves the store, gets in her car -- mission accomplished.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Where you gonna be during all this?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I'm gonna be sittin' at the titty bar In downtown L.A. till my man over here calls me and gives me the O.K. sign.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Who's paging you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ray, the A.T.F. guy.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That works on my nerves, you bein' so buddy-buddy with him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If I wasn't, this wouldn't work. Now once I deliver I'll have to trust you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, I've been trusting you all this time, haven't I? We agreed on ten percent of what you bring in and that's what you gonna get.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And a hundred thousand if I go to jail.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: We're partners, Baby, sorta. I ain't gonna screw you. You haven't told me where I put it for you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Give it to the bail bondsman, Max Cherry. He'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Max Cherry? You and him friends now? You tell him about this shit?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He won't know where the money came from. Only that it's money.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: It's boring, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I can sit through it once.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He thinks he's Joe Gunn now.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm impressed. He knows a lot.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He's just repeating shit he overheard. He ain't any more a gun expert than I am.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Want a hit?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: When did you get out of jail?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Four days ago.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Where at?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Susanville.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Two months shy of four years.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Four years?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Bank robbery.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Really, I'm impressed.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Is it ready to go?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Yeah, there's another hit left.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yeah, I'm just gettin' old. I can't smoke or laugh now it seems without coughing.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Coughing opens up the capillaries. When you cough, you're getting air -- in this case smoke -- to parts of the lung that don't normally get used. Coughing's good -- gets ya higher. My dad coughs when he smokes all the time.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Want a Metrix?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What's a Metrix?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: It's like this major meal in a shake you drink instead of having a big meal.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's a diet thing?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: No, it's what body builders drink to beef up.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: The roller disco one.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Fourteen.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You're fourteen years old here?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I thought you were sixteen.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I was pretty much the same height now as I was then.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Were you a disco girl?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Noooo, I was a surfer girl. Besides, I was only fourteen. I couldn't go to discos.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: So where did you go?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: The beach. Or get high, drop acid at a friend's place. I was a K.L.O.S. girl. I hated disco.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: That was taken at a place called "Flippers." It was in Hollywood. Were you in L.A. back then?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Detroit.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: With Ordell?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We had done time together already.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Were you a disco guy?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: C'mon, don't lie.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I don't like dancing.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Did you ever go I one?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I went to a few just to meet women. But I don't like to dance, and it's so fuckin; loud. During that whole scene I just drank in bars.  Who didn't make the cut?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: That's a picture of me in Japan.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You been to Japan?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I lived there for about nine months.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You lived in Japan, when?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: About five years ago.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who's arm is that?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: That's the guy I lived with... his name was... Hirosh.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Must of made quite an impression.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I never got to know him, really. I couldn't speak Japanese, and his English was terrible. But I couldn't say anything, because his English was better than my Japanese.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That sounds like a problem.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Not really. We didn't have much to say to each other anyway. I never got to know him that well, but I knew enough to know I wasn't missing much. I keep that, because of all the fuckin' time I was there, that's the only picture I got of me in Japan.  That's Japan.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Wanna fuck?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yeah, that really hit the spot.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Now that's over, let's get to know each other.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Is it dead?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Well, so far he is. But you have to admit he's not too bright.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I wouldn't go so far as to say that.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He killed a man worked for him the other night.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: So what are you trying to tell me? I should get out of here?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: That's not what I'm saying at all.  You know where he went?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He went to meet that stewardess.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Does that bother you?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You live with him.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I live here. He drops in and out. He tell you about that half-million dollars he's got in Mexico?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Uh-huh?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Course he did, he tells everybody who'll listen. That's what he's doin' with this stewardess. He's scheming how he can get it over here.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And your point is?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Let him and that stewardess get that money over here...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Uh-huh?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: ...and just take it from him.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We're leaving now!

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: All right already.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Jesus Christ, get a grip, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We shoulda been there already and we woulda been if it hadn't been for your fuckin' around!

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: That's a nice outfit on her. I'm gonna go over and look at this Michi Moon display.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Just stay right fuckin' here, all right?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Are you sweating?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What are you doin'?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I'm getting out of here. What do you think?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Lemme have the bag.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Fuck you. I can carry it.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Goddam you. Gimme that bag,

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Watch it, dipshit. You wanna rip the fuckin' bag?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Gimme that bag before I knock you out and take it.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm carrying it.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Okay, you got it. Just take a chill pill, for christ sake.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Is it this aisle, Lou-is?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yeah, down the end.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Is it this aisle or the next one over?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: This one.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I mean it. Don't say one fuckin' word.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Okay, Lou-is.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Thanks, Baby.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who's your partner?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: See, what did I tell you? Man in New York wants a 9 millimeter Smith and Wesson Model 5946. Why does he want it? It's the gun that nigga on "New York Undercover" uses. Because of that nigga, I can sell it to this nigga for twelve-fifty.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What's your cost?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: As low as two.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Are you serious?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That's what I been tellin' you. Start adding these motherfuckin' figures up, and you tell me this ain't a business to be in.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I got me five M-60 machine guns. These came straight from the Gulf War. I sold me three of them so far, twenty grand a piece.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's good money.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Louis, this is it, man. I'm gonna make me a million dollars out of this. I already got me a half-a- million sittin' in Mexico. When I do this last delivery, I'm gonna make me another half-million.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I get out. Spend the rest of my life spending.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm going to wait in the car.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Sure.  We almost done, ain't we?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Take the keys, man. Listen to music.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Which one is for the car?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: This one's for the ignition...  ...but you gotta hit this thing to shut the alarm off and unlock the door.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What do I do?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You ain't got to do nothing. Just point at it and push the button. You'll hear the car go "bleep." That means the alarm's off and the doors are open.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Now play the volume as loud as you want but don't touch my levels. I got them set just the way I want 'em.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Louis, my man. Watcha doin'?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Oh, I dunno. Watching TV.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Whatcha watchin'?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Nothin' really. Just kinda goin' back and forth. They had some black girl from some black show on Jay Leno. I watched that for a bit, but I kept flippin channels cause I didn't know who she was.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Guess where I am?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I dunno.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I know you don't know. I said guess.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: The moon -- I dunno

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I'm talkin' to you from the comfy- cozy interior of an Oldsmobile parked outside your nasty-ass welfare motel.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You're outside?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: C'mon in.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Naw, man. I just told you, I'm comfortable. I ain't about to walk into that roach motel and get uncomfortable. You bring your ass out here.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm in my underwear.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Then put your goddam drawers on, and get your ass out here. I got somethin' to show you.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That was Beaumont.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who was Beaumont?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: An employee I had to let go.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What did he do?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: He put himself in a situation where he was gonna have to do ten years in the penetentiary, that's what he did.  And if you know Beaumont, you know there ain't no way in hell he can do no ten years. And if you know that, you know Beaumont's gonna go any goddam thing Beaumont can to keep from doin' those ten years including telling the Federal government everything they want to know about my ass. Now that, my friend, is a clear case of him or me. And you best believe it ain't gonna be me. You know what I'm sayin'? You gonna come in on this with me, you gotta be prepared to go all the way. I got me so far over a half-a-million dollars sittin' in lockboxes in a bank in Cabo San Lucas. Me and Mr. Walker make us one more delivery, I'm gonna have me over a million. You think I'm gonna let this little cheese eatin' nigga here fuck that up? Shit, you better think again. 'Fore I let this deal get fucked up, I'll shoot that nigga in the head, and ten niggas look just like em.  Understand what I'm sayin'?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: So we on the same page then?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I follow.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I didn't look like a bum.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: But you did have a Salvation Army- thing going.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: How much is there?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Over half-million dollars worth of merchandise.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Can I ask you about Melanie?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What's your relationship?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She one of the women I got set up. I got Melanie in Hermosa Beach. I rent Simone a small house in Compton, and about four blocks away I got me this nineteen-year-old country girl named Sheronda. I found her waitin' for a bus two days outta Alabama, barefoot, country as a chicken coop. Took her to my house in Compton, told her it was Hollywood.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: She believed you?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hell, yeah. To her dumb country ass, Compton is Hollywood. Close as she's ever been, anyway.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: If this is about you fucked Melanie, I don't give a damn. I ain't a fool. I leave you alone with a bitch like Melanie, you're gonna be fuckin' that twenty minutes after I'm out the door. So say "thank you" and I'll tell you, "you're welcome."

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's not what I meant when I asked did you trust her.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She tryin' to work your ass against me, ain't she?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You didn't even hafta say it. I know the woman.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Well, why the fuck keep her around?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: 'Cause she my fine little surfer gal. She can't do me no harm. Fact she think she can play you against me shows how little she knows. You could teach that bitch for days how it is 'tween me an you, she never understand a damn word.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Why do you let someone know your business you can't trust?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I don't hafta trust her, I know her.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You can't trust Melanie. But you can always trust Melanie to be Melanie.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I still don't understand why you keep her around.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I told you, man.  She my fine little surfer gal.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hang it up, she's on her way. You gotta listen to this. This involves you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, you the one in motherfuckin' charge.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Well, she keeps saying 'in a minute.'

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Go in there, snatch her by the hair, and drag her big ass out. This is my goddam money we're talking about. Get your ass out the door.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's Louis.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Did you get it?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I got it. Listen, there's something else I have to tell you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: When I see you. Pick me up at Sam's. You count the money?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I haven't even looked at it yet, it's still in the shopping bag.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Melanie must be dyin' to see it.  Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's what I got to talk to you about. You see, Melanie was giving me a hard time --

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Not now, pick me up.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You keep drivin' down Ninth, to where they got all them car dealerships. We're gonna leave this heap in a parking lot and get one the cops don't know about.  Hey, where's Melanie?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's what I gotta tell you. She bugged me the whole time. Got pissy with me 'cause I wouldn't let her carry the bag. Started running her fuckin' mouth... I couldn't remember right away when we came out where the car was parked, so she got on me about that. "Is it this aisle Lou- is, is it that one?" She was totally fuckin' with my nerves.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: So what, you left her there.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I shot her.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You shot Melanie?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Twice. In the parking lot.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Couldn't talk to her?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You know how she is.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You couldn't just hit her?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Maybe... but at that moment... I dunno...

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You shot her twice?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: So you're sure she's dead.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Pretty sure.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Where did you shoot her?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: In the chest and stomach.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, if you had to do it, you had to do it. What we don't want is that bitch surviving on us. Anybody but that woman.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Louis?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Where's the rest of it?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: How much it there?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Maybe forty, maybe not that much.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You said five hundred and fifty!

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: So you light, ain't you. You light about a half-a-million.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Look, that's the bag she came out with. She never even put her hand in it, and neither did I.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Came outta where?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: The fitting room. It went down exactly the way it was supposed to.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: How long was she in there?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Maybe a minute. She came right out.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Louis, You tellin' me the truth?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Look, I swear to fucking god, she came out with that bag and I took it from her.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We went to the parking lot.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Where you shot her.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You sure she ain't somewhere with a half-a-million dollars I worked my ass off to earn?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Fuck you for asking me that.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Pull the car over.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What'd you shoot her with?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's in there.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Okay, so it was Jackie Brown.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: If she's got it, why didn't she take it all?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: 'fore I blow that bitch's brains out, I'll ask her.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Maybe the Feds got it.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: If there were nothin; in here but towels, maybe she didn't get a chance to take it from her suitcase and A.T.F. got it. But, she put these fuckin' books in here to trick our ass.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's why I never checked it. The bag felt right.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Then she throws forty thousand in here, to rub the shit in my face, know what I'm saying? She wants me to know she ripped me off.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I don't know. Either she has it or the Feds.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Or...  ...she gave it to somebody else first, before Melanie went in the dressing room.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You know who I saw in the dress department?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I didn't really think anything of it. No -- I did wonder what he was doing there, but didn't think it had anything to do with us. You know like maybe he was there with his wife or girlfriend.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You gonna tell me who it was?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Max Cherry.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You see Max Cherry in the dress department. We're about to be handed half-a-million dollars -- Man, look at me when I'm talking to you! And you don't think nothing of him being there!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Do Max Cherry and Jackie Brown know each other?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hell, yes, they know each other. He bonded her out of county.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: How am I supposed to know that?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You know the motherfucker's a bail bondsman, don't ya? You know every last one of them motherfuckers is crooked as hell?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Why should I think anything's weird, if I don't know nothin' about them knowing each other?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Man, I don't want to hear your fuckin' excuses!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I ain't givin' you fuckin' excuses, I'm givin' you reasons.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Oh, you gonna tell me the reason you lost all the goddam money I got in the world! Let me tell you the reason, motherfucker! The reason is, your ass ain't worth a shit no more!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm going out for a few hours.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Hold on a minute.  Where you going?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm going to Del Amo, see a movie, get something to eat.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Watcha gonna see?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Whatever looks best and starts the soonest.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Have fun.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're right, that was Ordell. You have time, you think you could find out for me where he's staying?

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Cops can't locate him, huh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They don't have your winning personality.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Sure thing. I don't have to know what I'm doing, long as you know.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I think I do. Is that good enough?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How can I help you?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Where would you like me to put my ash?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's Winston. He works here.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: He's a big one. You two tight?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: It was our idea to take the picture, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So, you want a ten-thousand dollar bond. What've you got for collateral?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Gonna have to put up cash.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You have it with you?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: It's in my bag.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You have cash. What do you need me for?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: C'mon, you know how they do. Black man comes in with ten thousand, they wanna fuck with 'em. First off, they gonna wanna know where I got it. Second, they gonna keep a big chunk of it -- start talkin' that court cost shit. Fuck that shit, Jack. I'll go through you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Cost you a thousand for the bond.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who's it for? A relative?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Fella named Beaumont. They have him up at county. It started out drunk driving, but they wrote it up "possession of a concealed weapon." Dumb monkey-ass had a pistol on him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ten thousand sounds high.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: They ran his name and got a hit. He's been in before.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He takes off and I gotta go to Kentucky to bring him back, you pay the expenses.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You think you could do that?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's his full name?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Beaumont. That's the only name I know.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Getting there.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You go wait in the car. Wait a minute.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Beaumont Livingston.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Livingston, huh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: On his prior, he served nine months, and he's working on four years' probation.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You don't say.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Do you know what he's on probation for?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Haven't a clue.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Possession of unregistered machine guns.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Will they consider this a violation of his probation?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They do consider this a violation of his probation. Your boy's looking at ten years, plus the concealed weapon.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Man, he won't like that. Beaumont don't got a doin' time disposition.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I need your name and address.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Ordell Robbie. O-R-D-E-L-L. R-O-B-B- I-E. 1436 Florence Boulevard. Compton 90222.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: House or apartment?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: House.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Now I need you to count your money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Across the street a Great Western. It goes in a trust account. You'll need to fill out an Application for Appearance Bond, an Indemnity Agreement, a Contingent Promissory Note. That's the one, if Beaumont skips and I go after him, you pay the expenses.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Beaumont ain't going nowhere.  Where do I sign?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hey, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I was wondering. What if before the court date gets here, Beaumont gets hit by a bus or something and dies.  I get my money back, don't I?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Comfortable?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: The door was opened, so I just came right in.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I can see that. Why?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I got some more business for ya.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh, yeah? What did he do?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She is an airline stewardess. Got caught coming back from Mexico with some blow. They set her bond this afternoon at ten thousand. Now, what I was thinkin', you could use the ten thousand you owe me from Beaumont and move it over on to the stewardess.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The bond for possession is only a thousand.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: They fuckin' wit' her. They callin' it Possession with Intent. A black woman in her forties gets busted with less than two ounces on her, they call that shit Intent. Same shit happened to a movie star. It's Possession.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It still sounds high.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She had, I believe it was... fifty grand on her, too. There was a cop at the hearing. Young guy with L.A.P.D. wanted her bond set at twenty- five thousand, saying there was a risk of flight. Jackie being a stewardess and all.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Before we start talking about stewardess, let's get Beaumont out of the way first.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Somebody already did.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You didn't hear?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hear what?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Somebody with a grudge blew Beaumont's brains out -- hey, that rhymes -- blew Beaumont's brains out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Did the police contact you?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Very first motherfuckin' thing they did. They see I put up a big money bond on my boy, they start thinking with that where-there's-smoke-there's fire logic. They roust my ass outta bed, ten o'clock in the morning. Fuckin' scare my woman, Sherona, half to death. She thought they were gonna take my ass away for sure.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The stewardess. Do you know her last name?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Brown, Jackie Brown.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What does she do for you?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Who says she does anything for me? She's my friend. When my friends get into trouble, I like to help 'em out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Beaumont worked for you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That's what the police thought. I told them I'm unemployed, how could I have anybody work for me? Now I bail out Jackie, I'm liable to have the police on me again, huh? Wanting to know was she doing things for me, was she bringing me that money!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Was she?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Is this, me and you, like a lawyer- client relationship? The lawyer can't tell nothing he hears?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're not my client until you get busted and I bond you out.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: If there's no -- what do you call it -- confidentiality between us? Why would I tell you anything?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Cause you want me to know what a slick guy you are. You got stewardesses bringing you fifty grand.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Why would a stewardess bring me fifty grand?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You want me to speculate on what you do. I'd say you're in the drug business, except the money's moving in the wrong direction. Whatever you're into, you seem to be getting away with it, so more power to you. Okay you want another bond, and you want to move over the ten thousand you put down on Beaumont to the stewardess. That means paperwork. I have to get a death certificate, present it to the court, fill out a receipt for return of bond collateral, then type up another application. An indemnity agreement --

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Jackie ain't got time for all that shit --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm telling you what I have to do. What you have to do, in case you forgot, is come up with premium of a thousand bucks.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I got it. I just don't got it on me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well, come back when you do, and I'll bond out the stewardess.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Man, you know I'm good for it. Thousand bucks ain't shit.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If I don't see it in front of me, you're right. It ain't shit.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Man, you need to look at this with a little compassion. Jackie ain't no criminal. She ain't used to this kinda treatment. I mean, gangsters don't give a fuck -- but for the average citizen, coupla nights in County fuck with your mind.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ordell, this isn't a bar, an you don't have a tab.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Just listen for a second. We got a forty-year-old, gainfully employed black woman, falsely accused --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Falsely accused? She didn't come back from Mexico with cocaine on her?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Falsely accused of Intent. If she had that shit -- and mind you, I said "if" -- it was just her shit to get high with.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is white guilt supposed to make me forget I'm running a business?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Is that what I think it is?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What's up with this shit.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I think falling in live with movie stars is something that happens to a man as he gets older.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You know who this is?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Mister Robbie, isn't it? I have the ten thousand you put up. Isn't that why you called.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The bond collateral on Beaumont Livingston you moved over to cover Miss Brown, remember?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She got off, huh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They decided to no-file. Tell me where you are and I'll bring you your money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You still there?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Looky here, I know you helped her and I know you know what I want. Jackie can tell me any story come in that pretty head of hers. Long as at the end of that story, she hands over my money. She do that, we're still friends. Now, she don't wanna be my friend no more, tell her to think about ol' Louis. And if she tries to turn me in, I'll name her ass as my accessory. We'll go upstate together. Hand in handcuffed hand. Now that shit's a promise, understand what I'm sayin'? You tell her that, and I'll call you back.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What the fuck you doin' knockin on the door like the goddamn police? You lookin' to get shot?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I thought you might be asleep.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You keep fuckin' with me, you're gonna be asleep forever.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm alone.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Git your ass in here.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That's all?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I have a bond receipt for you to sign.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You know what the fuck I'm talkin' about. You talk to her?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She wants to give you your money. If she didn't, there'd be cops batter- ramming the door right now.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: How'd you find me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Winston found you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: How the fuck did he find me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's what Winston does. He finds people who don't want to be found.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, bully for that nigga. You say she wants to give me the money, huh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, give it to me then.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She wants to give it to you herself and collect her ten percent. She also wants to explain why she had to hold on to it.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I'd like to hear that too. Turn around and put your hands on your head.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Jackie didn't trust Melanie. She'd already tried to get Jackie to go in with her, split the half million amongst themselves. What she did was take quite a risk to see you get your money.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Lift up your pant leg. You help her?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: All I did was walk out with it.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: And you did that to protect my interest?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: In a way, yes.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: My ass be dumb, but I'm not a dumbass. Go sit over there on the couch.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This place stinks.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You get used to it after a while. Now tell me where my money's at.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: My office.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: And where's Jackie?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She's been there since Thursday night.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She wanted to see me, why wasn't she home?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She was afraid.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That I gotta see.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She still is. She doesn't want to get shot before she can tell you what happened.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Have her bring the money here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's in the safe. She can't get at it.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Call her, tell her the combination.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm telling you, you got her spooked. She won't leave there till you have your money and you're gone.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You expect me to just walk in there?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If she wanted to set you up, you'd be in custody right now. When you said you'd name her as an accessory she believed you. That scares her more than anything.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: That's why she's givin' up my money huh? Not that bullshit about Melanie. I didn't trust her ass neither, but I knew how to handle her. She was my blonde-headed little surfer gal. I fuckin' told Louis he could've just given her a punch in the mouth, he didn't need to shoot her. She's at your office.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: By herself. That big mandingo nigga Winston ain't there, is he?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She's all alone.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I call your office, she better answer the phone.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She will.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's the next street.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I know where it is.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Turn left.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I know where to turn.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: My money's in that office, right?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: She starts givin' me some bullshit about it ain't there. It's somewhere else and we can go get it.  I'm shootin' you in the head right then and there. Then I'm gonna shoot her in the kneecap, find out where my godamn money is. I go walkin' in there and that nigga Winston or anybody else is in there, you're the first man shot, understand what I'm sayin'?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Now, is there anything you want to tell me before we get out of this car?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You better be, motherfucker.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Get that for me, will ya baby?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You know it's for you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: It's Beaumont.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: We're back.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: 'Ola!

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Hey, hey, hey. I think somebody's got some new clothes.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: We been shoppin'. Can't have my boy running around lookin' like a bum on the street.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Ha-ha-ha. I'm serious, you smoke too much of that shit. That shit robs you of your ambition.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Not if your ambition is to get high and watch TV.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hello.  Hey, Jackie...  No, Jackie, I didn't get your message.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I was gonna tell you...

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hope you don't mind keeping him company.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Try not to rip his clothes off 'em they're new.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Cherry Bail Bonds.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Let me speak to Max Cherry.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: He ain't here right now.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: He leave town?

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: He's around.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Give me his home number.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: I'll give you his beeper.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Get me out of here.

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: Where do you want to go?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Take me home.

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: Home?  This is your home. You're dead.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Dead? No. I just hurt my back. I'm not dead.

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: What are you then?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm alive.

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: Then what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know. I don't know.  This isn't happening.

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: What isn't happening?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Let me out of here!

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: There is no out of here. You've been killed. Don't you remember?
